channel.title: Posts on BioViz Graph Gallery
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on BioViz Graph Gallery

item.title: Scatterplots
item.description: Definition A scatter plot (also called a scatter graph, scatter chart, scattergram, or scatter diagram) is a type of plot or mathematical diagram using Cartesian coordinates to display values for typically two variables for a set of data. If the points are color-coded, one additional variable can be displayed. The data is displayed as a collection of points, each having the value of one variable determining the position on the horizontal axis and the value of the other variable determining the position on the vertical axis.

item.title: About
item.description: About Description This page accompanies the graphical visualization package BioViz. BioViz is a collection of visualization scripts used in the day to day work in the Biomarker group at RCSS Be aware that the package is still under development! If you encounter any errors or have suggestions please get in touch. Author Information Jens Hooge

item.title: Volcano Plot
item.description: Volcano Plot A volcano plot is a type of scatter-plot that is used to quickly identify changes in large data sets composed of replicate data. It plots significance versus fold-change on the y and x axes, respectively. These plots are increasingly common in omic experiments such as genomics, proteomics, and metabolomics where one often has a list of many thousands of replicate data points between two conditions and one wishes to quickly identify the most meaningful changes.
